justification: “To measure the accuracy of participants' political knowledge, we used d′ as specified in an SDT framework … to quantify participants' ability to discern true from false political statements.”

“Analogously, we quantified metacognition as the degree to which participants' confidence judgments differentiated between correct and incorrect accuracy judgments … we computed metacognitive sensitivity … an additional d′—meta-d′.”
“Relative metacognitive sensitivity—metacognitive efficiency—can be calculated as … a ratio (M ratio = meta-d′ / d′) … factoring out the confounding influence of object-level performance.”
“Relative metacognitive sensitivity—metacognitive efficiency—can be calculated as either a ratio … or a difference score (M diff = meta-d′ − d′).”
